data.scheme_name: West Bengal Incentive Scheme 2020 for Approved Industrial Park - Fiscal Incentives
data.benefits: Scheme provide incentive of Rs. 200 lakhs - Rs. 1000 lakhs on Basic and Essential Common Infrastructure Facilities, incentive for Common Effluent Treatment Plant @ Rs. 5 lakh per acer and reimbursement of Stamp Duty.
data.eligibility: Any industries association or any enterprise forming a  Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) are eligible under this scheme
data.conditions:
The minimum land area required for development of an AIP will be 20 acres.
Each AIP shall plan and provide land plot/ shed / buildings/ installations for a minimum 20 number of MSME Units.
SPV shall manage AIP for minimum of 5 years from completion or 80% to MSME.
The Land Bifurcation under this scheme, mandates that at least 10% of the total area of land be designated as open space

data.nodal_agency: West Bengal Small Industries Development Corporation Ltd
data.context: To initiate and promote growth of micro, small and medium enterprises with advanced technology and environmental compliances resulting in more employment opportunities in west Bengal.
data.objective: The objective of the Scheme is to help private companies build industrial parks on their own land by offering financial and other incentives. This will support the growth of small and medium-sized businesses, create jobs, advance technology, and improve environmental standards in the state.
data.description: Scheme provide incentive of 200 lakhs - 1000 lakhs on Basic and Essential Common Infrastructure Facilities, incentive for Common Effluent Treatment Plant @ 5 lakh per acer and reimbursement of Stamp Duty.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through this link: https://silpasathi.wb.gov.in/user/login
data.funding_facilitator: West Bengal Small Industries Development Corporation Ltd
data.funding_mechanism: The Department shall release the incentive amount to WBSIDCL on receipt of recommendation of SLEC. WBSIDCL shall disburse the fund to the SPV within 7 working days of the receipt of the fund from the Department.
data.additional_info:
WBSIDCL can change up to 2% as administrative charges on Incentive amount.

The Land Bifurcation under this scheme, mandates that at least 10% of the total area of land be designated as open space, in accordance with the guidelines of the Ministry of Environment and Forest. The total land allocation includes a minimum of 60% dedicated to industrial activities, a maximum of 5% for hostel, housing, or guest house facilities, and the remaining portion allocated for basic and essential common facilities.

For industrial parks (AIPs) larger than 60 acres, after allocating space for at least 20 MSMEs, the park can also include additional logistic facilities like warehouses, cold storage, and godowns. These facilities should be available for rent or lease. Other services like banks, ATMs, primary health centers, and daycare centers are also permitted within the park. However, no other commercial activities are allowed in the industrial park.

SPV  shall construct/ install the mandatory Basic and Essential Common Infrastructural Facilities which have been identified and approved by SLEC.

Incentive shall not be eligible for utility shifting/ excessive land filling/ water drainage in the AIP.

Construction has not started within 3 month- Cancellation of application and no incentive available.

After getting in principal approval, within 2 years, AIP shall allot minimum 80% of Basic and Essential Common Infrastructure Facilities to MSME. If there's delay beyond SPV control, Maximum 6 months extension shall be given from SLEC.
In case SPV defaults, AIP approval withdrawn on end of 2 years or after extended time.

No alternation of Shareholding pattern before approval from SLEC. If not, refund incentive amount.

SPV to allot land to MSME through open advertisement in newspaper. 

WBSIDCL to be facilitation cell for all approvals for SPV. Before installation of CETP- SPV to get approval from WBSIDCL.

MSME under AIP can avail benefit under other schemes also.
data.checklist_info_a:
Application for approval of industrial park:
1.Registration certificate of the applicant Private Sector/ SPV.
2. Memorandum and Articles of Associations of Private Sector/ SPV.
3. Company credentials and Financial Statements (Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss) of the Private Sector companies
forming the SPV in last 3 years.
4. Copy of land deed / legal possession of the land for the park. (if available)
5. Any other documents /papers required to be submitted in accordance with EOI/ RFP/ RFQ.

Application for grant of incentive:
1. Registration Certificate of the SPV.
2. Memorandum and Articles of Association of the SPV.
3. Shareholders Agreement of the SPV.
4. Approved Layout plan.
5. Land deed.
6. Certificate for mutation and conversion of land.
7. Consent to Establish Certificate from WBPCB.
8. Other statutory approvals/ clearances / licenses.
9. Approval notification under the Scheme and approved extension if any.
10. Certificate of completion of construction of Basic and Common Infrastructure Facilities and CETP, if any.
11. Details of MSMEs with EM no. to which plot of land/ shed / buildings/ installations have been allotted
12. Detailed expenditure statement certified by a Chartered Accountant.
13. O&M Plan
14. Any other documents/ papers found necessary
